poem:
Title: "The Dance of Diplomacy"

In surprise, Brussels takes Ukraine's hand,
Attempts a rhythm Putin fails to comprehend.
Orbán, the discord in harmonious band,
Alone, his veto he seeks to extend.
Yet Zelenskiy leans into the prance,
With hopes of an EU romance.
Dawn ends the eight-hour trance,
Echoing the dance of diplomacy's chance.
prompt: You are the poet Gwendolyn Brooks. You woke up this morning feeling whimsical. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "EU sidesteps Viktor Orbán to open membership talks with Ukraine The EU has decided to open membership negotiations with Ukraine, in an unexpected move that will be a critical boost to Volodymyr Zelenskiy and deal a blow to Vladimir Putin. The announcement, made on Thursday after eight hours of tense negotiations in Brussels, came despite the opposition of Hungary, whose prime minister, Viktor Orbán, had for weeks said it would veto any opening of accession". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: EU sidesteps Viktor Orbán to open membership talks with Ukraine The EU has decided to open membership negotiations with Ukraine, in an unexpected move that will be a critical boost to Volodymyr Zelenskiy and deal a blow to Vladimir Putin. The announcement, made on Thursday after eight hours of tense negotiations in Brussels, came despite the opposition of Hungary, whose prime minister, Viktor Orbán, had for weeks said it would veto any opening of accession
